Job Title: Strategic Sourcing Manager – Corporate Services

Location: Knoxville Metropolitan Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Purchasing, Supply Chain

Description:
Genesys empowers more than 7,500 organizations in over 100 countries to improve loyalty and business outcomes by creating the best experiences for customers and employees. Through Genesys Cloud, the #1 AI-powered experience orchestration platform, Genesys delivers the future of CX to organizations of all sizes so they can provide empathetic, personalized experiences at scale. As the trusted, all-in-one platform born in the cloud, Genesys Cloud accelerates growth for organizations by enabling them to differentiate with the right customer experience at the right time.

We employ more than 6,000 people across the globe who embrace empathy and cultivate collaboration to succeed. And, while we offer great benefits and perks like larger tech companies, our employees have the independence to make a larger impact on the company and take ownership of their work. Join the team and create the future of customer experience together.

Genesys is seeking a Strategic Sourcing Manager – Corporate Services to join the Strategic Sourcing team as an individual contributor that will manage strategic projects in a complex, multi-business segment environment. The individual will manage our Consulting spend amongst other adjacent categories (i.e., Professional Services) and will be involved in all phases of the procurement process including, but not limited to, business partnerships, spend analysis, RFx, negotiations, contract management, and supplier performance management. While carrying out sourcing activities, the Strategic Sourcing Manager – Corporate Services will provide meaningful commercial leadership while developing and executing creative strategies to ensure work is conducted with rigorous professional standards in full compliance with organizational governance. This role requires close alignment with business leads and cross functional teams.

 

The Strategic Sourcing Manager – Corporate Services will be expected to deliver savings by working in a cross-functional team environment and regularly interacts with senior leaders or executive levels by providing subject matter expertise for key categories while challenging spend behavior to ensure strategic sourcing process and decision making are firmly embedded in each function.

 

Job Responsibilities:

Lead the strategy for the Consulting category in close partnership and alignment with the Strategic Sourcing Manager – Global Contingent Labor. Conduct a thorough analysis of the consulting vendor landscape and make recommendations on developing out a Genesys Consulting Preferred Vendor Program. Clearly define Genesys Corporate Services Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) including writing and implementing a Supplier Manual, managing key suppliers, including quarterly business reviews, performing root cause analysis and resolution, developing and monitoring supplier performance and improvement plans. Develop and manage new and existing supplier relationships, with a focus on managing performance and cost and service continuous improvement. Identify, select, and qualify the "best" suppliers in the industry per category utilizing strategic supply base analysis. Compile and maintain supplier and industry strategic analysis portfolios. Successfully negotiate Master Services Agreements (MSAs) that include SLAs, standard markup rates, rate cards, rebates, and volume and tenure rate discounts. Create internal and external training/communication for both consulting vendors and internal business partners. Conduct market-rate analysis and benchmarking while negotiating consulting bill rates. Works closely with C-level executives of the organization to understand and implement key business initiatives.  Develops and delivers formalized presentations of project objectives and results. Involved in developing, modifying, and executing company policies that affect immediate operation(s) and may also have company-wide effect.  Implement strategic policies when selecting methods, techniques, and evaluation criteria for obtaining results.  Deliver and demonstrate comprehensive category expertise according to project priorities. Responsible for securing materials and services at the lowest total cost of ownership through analysis of bids, and all other costs of ownership. Responsible for resolving any problems with materials, delivery, or the supplier relationship. Implement strategic policies when selecting methods, techniques, and evaluation criteria for obtaining results. Manage stakeholders, understand their needs, align purchasing and business goals and plan communications. Lead cross-functional teams to generate, sell and implement cost reduction ideas. Develop and implement annual cost savings programs and strategies that closely affect company financial results. Work within a cross-cultural, multi/country team to nurture performance. Produce risk analyses and mitigation tactics to projects, relationships, and contracts. Deliver a range of reports relating to and including savings tracking, project status, savings forecasts and spend profiles to key stakeholders. Ensure metrics and action plan are in place for continuous improvement. 

Position Requirements:

Minimum of 8 years of experience with a Bachelor’s Degree in Supply Chain, Business, Finance, or related field; 6 years and a Master’s degree, or a PhD with 3 years of experience or equivalent. 5+ years of labor procurement/strategic sourcing experience within the categories of: Consulting, Contract Labor and Professional Services preferably working for a Tech Company. Knowledge of relevant Global legal and compliance regulations. Demonstrated contract negotiation skills and experience of project/program management. Thorough interpersonal communication skills and the ability to work independently while shaping cross-functional partnerships. Excellent presentation skills (including C-suite experience). Ability to work well within a dynamic environment.Problem solving ability, detail-oriented ability to manage multiple tasks. You will have proactive approach to stakeholder management with the ability to influence at all levels within an organization. 

General Traits:

This is an exciting opportunity for an individual with passion and vision. The candidate must be creative and should be prepared to add value to the long-term direction of the Genesys External Workforce Experience.  You will lead the development and implementation of the Program to meet challenging business targets, including cost reduction, working capital improvement, productivity improvement, supplier relationship management effectiveness and supply base reduction. The role carries a high level of autonomy to deliver results within an environment where processes are currently being developed and implemented.

Proactive approach and creative vision, capable of understanding and then challenging the status quo, as appropriate. Requires the ability to change the thinking of, or gain acceptance from others in sensitive situations without damage to the relationship.  Functional Knowledge of Procurement processes: Category Planning, Contract Lifecycle Management, Strategic Sourcing and Supplier Relationship Management (SRM), Stakeholder Engagement. Proven leadership and influencing skills with track record for achieving objectives. Responsive to other functions within the company that depend upon this key function for successful performance; able to resolve potentially conflicting objectives across functions and with outside provider(s). Insights and experience managing change, results-driven, passionate about operations and technical excellence. Deep negotiating skills; able to identify win-win solutions in a complex situation; able to keep cool under pressure and be able to find solutions in difficult situations. Well-rounded business acumen and well-developed presence. Interfaces with function leaders at Director, Sr. Director, Vice-President and Senior Executive levels within Genesys from all business functions. 

Compensation:

This role has a market-competitive salary with an anticipated base compensation range listed below. Actual salaries will vary depending on a candidate’s experience, qualifications, skills, and location. This role might also be eligible for a commission or performance-based bonus opportunities.

$83,600.00 - $164,000.00

Benefits:

Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance. Telehealth coverageFlexible work schedules and work from home opportunitiesDevelopment and career growth opportunitiesOpen Time Off in addition to 10 paid holidays401(k) matching programAdoption AssistanceFertility treatments

More details about our company benefits can be found at the following link: https://mygenesysbenefits.com

If a Genesys employee referred you, please use the link they sent you to apply.

About Genesys:

Every year, Genesys orchestrates billions of remarkable customer experiences for organizations in more than 100 countries. Through the power of our cloud, digital and AI technologies, organizations can realize Experience as a Service™ our vision for empathetic customer experiences at scale. With Genesys, organizations have the power to deliver proactive, predictive, and hyper personalized experiences to deepen their customer connection across every marketing, sales, and service moment on any channel, while also improving employee productivity and engagement. By transforming back-office technology to a modern revenue velocity engine Genesys enables true intimacy at scale to foster customer trust and loyalty. Visit www.genesys.com.

Reasonable Accommodations:

If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you or someone you know may complete the Reasonable Accommodations Form for assistance. Please use the Candidate field in the dropdown menu to ensure a timely response.

This form is designed to assist job seekers who seek reasonable accommodation for the application process. Submissions entered for non-accommodation-related issues, such as following up on an application or submitting a resume, may not receive a response.

Genesys is an equal opportunity employer committed to equity in the workplace. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, domestic partner status, national origin, genetics, disability, military and veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

Please note that recruiters will never ask for sensitive personal or financial information during the application phase.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
